title: Flame in the Streets [1961 - UK] John Mills
description:
Flame in the Streets (1961 - UK)

Drama

starring . . . . John Mills, Sylvia Syms, Brenda de Banzie
 
http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0054879/


BAFTA Awards - Nominated - Best British Screenplay

Made in the wake of the 1959 Notting Hill riots, Flame in the Streets is a tense examination of racial prejudice. Tensions manifest at home, work and on the streets during Bonfire Night in the burgeoning West Indian community of post-war Britain. Trades Union leader Jacko Palmer fights for the rights of a black worker but struggles with the news that his own daughter, Kathie, is planning to marry a West Indian, much against his own logic and the hysterical prejudice of his wife Nell.


Video: XviD, 640x272, 23.976 fps, 1472 Kbps, 01h30m03s
Audio: MP3, 48000 Hz, mono, 60 kbps

DVDRip, English audio, no subtitles
